data.question: What is the chemical formula for CVMOF-DE?
data.answer: Zr6O32C84N6H52

data.question: What method was used to confirm the successful syntheses of CVMOFs?
data.answer: Powder X-ray diffraction (PXRD)

data.question: How were the mole fractions of longer linkers in CVMOF-AB determined?
data.answer: Based on 1H NMR results of the digested samples

data.question: Is the BET surface area of CVMOF-DE greater than that of MOF-D?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of using the SQUEEZE function in PLATON during the refinement of MOF-E?
data.answer: To remove the contribution of the electron density associated with disordered solvent molecules and anions

data.question: Did the synthesis of CVMOF-BC and CVMOF-DE with different linker ratios require the same amount of trifluoroacetic acid?
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the crystal system for CVMOF-DE?
data.answer: Cubic

data.question: What was the method used to estimate the porosity of CVMOFs?
data.answer: By N2 uptake at 77 K and 1 bar

data.question: Is the unit cell parameter 'a' for CVMOF-DE larger than that of MOF-D?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of n-hexane in the activation process of CVMOFs?
data.answer: It was used for solvent exchange due to its low surface tension, following the procedure reported by Matzger and co-workers

data.question: What was the main goal of the study on continuously variable MOFs (CVMOFs)?
data.answer: To realize the continuous variations of lattice dimension and pore size in a series of mixed-linker MOFs with various linker ratios

data.question: Did the synthesis of CVMOF-AB result in a physical mixture of two MOFs?
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the significance of using different linker ratios in the synthesis of CVMOFs?
data.answer: To precisely control the unit cell volumes, BET surface areas, and pore sizes in a wide range

data.question: Was the linker ratio in the starting materials always equal to those in the CVMOF products?
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the method used to determine the distribution of linkers within CVMOF-DE?
data.answer: Molecular modeling in combination with fluorescence quenching experiments

data.question: Can the synthetic strategy for CVMOFs be applied to other MOF systems with various metal nodes?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main finding from the fluorescence quenching experiments on CVMOF-DE?
data.answer: The distributions of two linkers within a mixed-linker MOFs can be determined by FÃ¶rster resonance energy transfer (FRET)-based fluorescence quenching

data.question: What was the role of Monte Carlo simulation in the study?
data.answer: To assess equilibrium structures of mixed linker MOFs and simulate the photoluminescence intensity as a function of LE (quencher) ratio

data.question: Was the PXRD pattern of CVMOF-DE based on the random model consistent with the experimental data?
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of conducting diffuse reflectance infrared Fourier transform spectroscopy (DRIFTs) and thermogravimetric analysis (TGA) on CVMOF-DE?
data.answer: To analyze the concentration of missing-linker defects in CVMOF-DE
